title: ICE: improper_ctypes: Option nonnull optimization not applied?

labels.name: A-lint
labels.description: Area: Lints (warnings about flaws in source code) such as unused_mut.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
### Code ```Rust use std::cell::UnsafeCell; extern "C" { pub fn foo(_: Option>); } ``` Code from playground linked in [this comment](https://zulip-archive.rust-lang.org/213817tlang/71355UnsafeCellTexposesnichesofTshouldit68206.html#185836886). Apparently, since that discussion took place the [`#[repr(no_niche)]`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/src/core/cell.rs.html#1643) flag got implemented and was added to `UnsafeCell`, yet the code for checking FFI-safety was perhaps not updated accordingly. ### Meta ``` note: rustc 1.50.0-nightly (5be3f9f10 2020-12-03) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C codegen-units=1 -C debuginfo=2 --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_lint/src/types.rs:774:13: improper_ctypes: Option nonnull optimization not applied? thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:958:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. ```
